fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Confluence is using the [new navigation and look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html] it is impossible to work with it using IE11. Hardly anything works, if it loads at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence with the new navigation and look
# Access it using IE11

h3. Expected Results
You can work with it.
h3. Actual Results
Almost nothing works (create pages, edit pages, navigate, etc). It's even not possible to switch to Confluence from JIRA.

h3.Workaround
Using another browser (Firefox, Chrome, Edge), access Confluence and opt out from the new navigation and look by clicking your profile picture at the bottom left and selecting the "_Opt out_" option.
fields.summary: Unable to work on Confluence using Internet Explorer 11 in the new look

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Anonymous users have access to space tools and the Space Directory, which is inconvenient even if they do not have access to modify anything.

h3. Suggestion
Provide an option to hide the space tools and the Space Directory from anonymous users

h3. Why this is important
* Security concerns - The Space Tools exposes some internal stuff (e.g. names of Administrators) that we're not really keen to open up to the world.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: users have access to Space Tools and Space Directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 Confluence page keeps refreshing continuously. 
   
h3. Description

A page in Confluence which contains a page tree macro keeps reloading continuously. This happens when users do not have permission to view the root page of the page tree macro.

h3. Environment
Affected Confluence Version 1000.1457.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- You will need two users to reproduce the problem. UserA and UserB.
1. Log in to Confluence as UserA 
2. Create a page and restrict it to UserA
3. Create another page, and insert a page tree macro into the page
4. Set the root page of the page tree macro to the page created above
5. Log out of Confluence
6. Log in as UserB
7. View the page with the page tree macro on it
8. Observe that the page continually refresh 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence page with a page tree macro loads correctly. 

h3. Actual Results
Confluence page with a page tree macro keeps refreshing continuously. 

h3. Notes
This issue will not occur on all pages with the page tree macros but only occurs when 
A confluence pages contains page tree macros with the root page set to a page the effected users do not have permission to view.

h3.Workaround
# Remove the page tree macro from the Confluence Page
# Restrict the page to only people that can see the root page of the page tree macro
fields.summary: Page Tree Macro causing a page to refresh continuously

fields.description:
We would like to give Confluence access to some of our external clients and want to be able to remove the ability for them to see and use these features below:
 # Calendars (Left-hand Nav)
 # Blogs (Left-hand Nav)
 # Questions (Left-hand Nav)
 # Page History 
 # Page Activity
 # Restrictions
 # Add Git Attachment
 # Page Information
 # Link to this Page...
 # View in Hierarchy
 # Space Admin Browser
 # View Source
 # View Add-ons Used
 # Copy
 # Move
 # Delete

I know the last three (14,15,16) can be restricted but can the rest of the right hand nav also be restricted? 

Ideally, we just want our external clients to be in a certain group (confluence permission groups) to view and export the pages we create.

Let me know if possible.
fields.summary: More permission limits / restrictions for certain accounts / groups

h3. Summary
Can not add inline comments for a specific page while selecting the letter "o".
The page returns the error: "We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.".


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to a Confluence page
# Usually happens when there is a link before a table
# Select the "o" letter inside a table that is inside a layout.
# Try to add an inline comment.

h3. Expected Results

Inline comments added normally

h3. Notes

# This issue happens with any browser for any user, not related to permissions.
# outside the table, could reproduce.
# deleting the layout, not reproducible.

h3.Workaround
Please highlight longer word or letter to avoid the bug.
fields.summary: Can not add inline comments for a specific page while selecting the letter "o"

fields.description:
We use Confluence Questions in a positive way internally to allow staff to vote on ideas for production, events, etc.

We would like to be able to judge questions on their scores, but find that because not all users are active, some questions are negatively swayed, as the more regular users may downvote ideas or suggestions to rank theirs higher.

We would like the ability to disable downvotes from both questions and answers within Confluence Questions.

In order to work around the current problem, we ask questions, and provide a 'yes' and a 'no' answer (or other alternatives) and request that users only vote UP the one that suits them. Questions themselves may be voted on as well, but negatively voting a question puts it down on the list, despite it maybe being a popular request (based on total number of upvotes).

Disabling the use of downvotes would be of great benefit for the way we use the software internally.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Downvotes on Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Manually enabled dark features are included in site export
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Example using ElasticSearch dark features

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Cloud, go to [https://yourdomain.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/darkfeatures.action]
 # Add the following dark features:
{code:java}
es.recent.updates
es.shadow.recent.updates
es.site.search
es.site.search.odd
{code}

 # Search for an item in Confluence (Note: search works)
 # Create a site export
 # Import it into Confluence Server v6.0+

h3. Expected Results

Dark features are reset to default
h3. Actual Results

Default dark features are not included in the export, but manually enabled dark features will be imported.

In the case of Elastic Search being enabled, when trying to search for anything, the following stack trace is thrown:
 !darkfeatures.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The following are enabled by default in Cloud, but are not included in the site export:
{code:java}
es.indexing
es.reindex
{code}
h3. Workaround
 # In the new instance, go to [https://your.base.url/admin/darkfeatures.action]
 # Remove the manually added dark features
fields.summary: Manually enabled dark features are included in site export

fields.description:
h3. SUMMARY
In a draft page, clicking 'Create' will prompt the user with "Another user moved this page"

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page
# Enter page page title and content (this is optional step. We get the same error even without page title and content)
# Let the page auto save as draft
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on 'Create' button at the top menu bar
 !2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result
New page should be created without error.

h3. Current result
Confluence throws error "Another user moved this page. It's ok, though - you can still publish your changes when you're ready."


h3. Workaround
'Save and close' the draft page that created in step 1, and then click on 'Create' button to create new page.
fields.summary: "Another user moved this page" when they didn't really.

fields.description:
*The Case:*
When trying to open existing page with restricted access, it should redirect an authenticated user to the new SPA URL schema and show "Request Access" view.
However, an anonymous user, in this case, should see 404 as it is now.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. create a restricted page.
2. login with another user and open the page, by accessing it via old pre-SPA URL schema (`/wiki/display/<SPACE_KEY>/<SLUG>`)

*Actual result:*
404 page, but the URL redirect flow finished on `bySlug` redirect step.

*Expected result:*
Confluence should redirect the user to the login page
fields.summary: 404 on bySlug step when redirecting from old url schema to new one

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When nesting a macro within a Page Properties the Page Properties report macro will not populate the macro content.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains a JIRA Issues Macro that will return some number of issues from JIRA.
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results

The page properties for the space will populate in the page properties report. 

h3. Actual Results

The Jira issues filter will just hang on "Getting issues".

Checking the browser's console we can see a 500 error on a POST:{noformat}POST https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientIds/ 500 ()  jquery-min.js:3 {noformat}

h3. Notes
Same issue with the *Table of Contents* macro instead of a *JIRA Issue* macro. The *Table of Content* is not displayed
fields.summary: Page properties report broken when using nested macros.

fields.description:
This is a subjective feeling, but I saw plenty of pages which were meant to be blogposts, after those three dots (...) to the right of 'Create' were introduced (turning off additional popup that was explicitly asking what you are going to create).

I think people might do it in next way:
1. select 'Blog' on the left toolbar
2. click 'Create' on the top toolbar
3. do not realise that the page is actually going to be created instead of blogpost
fields.summary: People accidentally create pages instead of blogposts

Confluence 1000.1337.0

# Create a page
# Insert JIRA issue filter macro (and configure a working filter)
# Insert the expand macro on the page or Issue Statistics Macron on the same page

It should display the macros correctly with their respective results.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1337.0

JIRA events update should be synchronized in Team Calendars immediately.

JIRA events update is not synchronized in Team Calendars immediately. It takes more 1-2 hours to be updated.

fields.description:
{panel:title=A note from Atlassian on the Excel macro|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
There are some known issues with the Excel macro right now that impact the display of spreadsheets. They're the result of some infrastructure changes that we're making for the overall benefit of Confluence Cloud users. We really regret any negative consequences this release has caused, and realize that any explanation of trade-offs will be of little comfort when you rely on this macro's functionality.

There unfortunately isn't a short-term fix for this issue, but we're investigating a better long-term solution for Excel and other Office files, and we'll update you when we have news to share. For further updates on this issue, please refer to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54876  
{panel}
h3. Summary

The Office Excel macro in Confluence formerly used to display Excel attachments as if they were an Excel file.
 Presently, they are being formatted as a simple table.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud version 1000.1337.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach Excel document to Confluence Page
 # Edit page, insert Office Excel Macro, select the attached Excel file

h3. Expected Results

Formatting should be as it is in Excel
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2017-05-16 at 3.44.48 PM.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No current workaround
fields.summary: Office Excel macro not formatting documents properly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently copying table from Confluence to JIRA is not possible as the table formating will be lost
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user to copy table between applications (Confluence -> JIRA) without losing the table formating
h3. Why this is important

It is important to have this feature as currently the only possible way is to add the table manually in JIRA using the following syntax (exclude < & >)

< ||Heading 1||Heading 2|| >
< |Col A1|Col A2| >
< |Col A1|Col A2| >
fields.summary: Copying tables from Confluence to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Multiple JIRA Issue Macros on a single page on Confluence Cloud are prone to fail with "_Unable to render JIRA issues macro. Connection to JIRA has timed out_".  The time to retrieve data for each macro significantly increases, the more JIRA Issues Macros are used in a page. This increase in time leads to timeout errors.

The issue also occurs for complex JQL when searching for issues using Jira Issues Macro, even though the amount of issues to be displayed is insignificant, Jira Issues Macro takes a long time to respond which can lead to Time Outs.

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the way Confluence Cloud retrieves data from JIRA Cloud and Jira Server/Data Center.

h3. Why this is important

There are use cases where Confluence pages are used to report data from JIRA.

h3. Workaround 

The workaround is to split multiple JIRA Issues Macros across multiple pages.
fields.summary: Improve performance of multiple JIRA issues macro on Cloud

fields.description: When a Confluence page or space is exported to PDF, the images therein are reduced in quality or resolution (DPI), thereby appearing blurred. As of now, there is no configurable option accessible to the user to change the image resolution for PDF exports. There are certain PDF related customizations that can be incorporated through *PDF Stylesheet* tab. Can there be an option using the same *PDF Stylesheet* tab to enter the required image resolution in DPI for PDF Exports? If PDFs do not show clear images, it will be useless to add images in any of the documents. Actually, a lot has been sacrificed in terms of design and documentation options, to project Atlassian Confluence as a collaboration tool. I do not really think, keeping images blurred in PDF Exports helps in any way.
fields.summary: Provide an Option to Customize Image Resolution for PDF Exports from Atlassian Confluence

h3. Summary
Per CONFCLOUD-45537, Image Effects are being temporarily removed from Confluence Cloud, however it appears that any images which are using the "Original" scaling option still show their effects when viewing the page

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page in Confluence and upload an Image
# Select "Original" for the image size and choose an Image Effect in Properties
# Add in another copy of the same image, this time, use a resizing option (Small, Medium, Large)
# Publish Page

h3. Expected Results
Per CONFCLOUD-45537, no image effects should show

h3. Actual Results
Images sized as "Original" show the image effect
!ImageScaling-Effects.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Image Effects are visible through the Editor however when the page is Published/Saved, the effects are no longer visible

h3.Workaround
Remove the Image Effect or Scale the Image

fields.description:
Scenario where Functionality would apply:
 * User is *watching* a Page/Space in Confluence
 * User is mentioned on a comment on this page/space
 * User will get both notifications, one for the update and one for the mention

# Create a backup of Confluence using the Backup Manager
# Restore the same backup file on the same Confluence cloud instance and check the Individual Space Permission ( *Space Tools > Permissions* )

The individual space permission should be existing on the imported space after the site import.

 !before export.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When a page, with a lot of version and dependencies (attachments and comment). When a change is triggered on the page, it will fire out a background task to index the changes. This background task take up a lot of resources and the task seems to be taking very long to complete.

With the latest implementation of amq, this causes the amq to pile up and affecting other functionality as well, such as notification.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

The bug was discovered on version {{Confluence Cloud 1000.1257.3}} and the page contains 1700+ attachments with nearly 1400 versions.

h2. Expected Result

The task should be optimized so that indexing for a small change would not take up so much resources.

h2. Actual Result

The resources being consumed by the task trying to index the page.

h2. Workaround

Atlassian Support team can manually remove the index task to give way to other task and ease out the performance. Please contact Cloud Support team if you encountered such bug.
fields.summary: Performance Issue when Indexing Page with Many Versions and Dependencies

fields.summary: Let edit username while creating user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In it's current state when multiple users are editing the same draft. Any user who selects publish will push all edits as all users are editing a single draft. 
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow real time collaboration functionality similar to google docs where every version is tracked and saved automatically similar i.e. Real time collaboration in Google Docs. That is to say all edits are revertible and specific to the changes each user has made. 

- It might be good to also have edits highlighted by other users and must be acknowledged by those users or at the very least the active "publishing" user before changes are pushed live. 
- Allow certain pages or content to be lockable during edits to disable collaborative editing during that instance of edit. 

h3. Why this is important

  This seems like a flaw that encourages mistakes without an easy way to mitigate them.
fields.summary: Better handling of draft publishing in regards to multiple realtime edits with collaborative editing.

fields.description:
We recently released a new file viewer for the Office Word, Office Powerpoint, Office Excel, and PDF macros, and the details are in this blog post: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blog/2017/05/new-file-viewer-for-the-office-and-pdf-macros].

 
{panel:title=A note from Atlassian on the Excel macro}
We've obviously received feedback from some of you that the Excel macro doesn't meet your needs or expectations. There are some known issues with it right now that impact the display of spreadsheets.

You may legitimately ask, why did we proceed with the rollout when these known issues exist? We're making infrastructure changes for the overall benefit of Confluence Cloud users, but they mean that we can't keep the old Office and PDF macros working any longer. We need to proceed with this rollout so we can move forward with the infrastructure changes, which have a much wider impact than this macro.

In saying that, we, of course, genuinely care about every user's experience with Confluence, and always want it to be the best. We really regret any negative consequences this release has caused, and realize that any explanation of trade-offs will be of little comfort when you rely on this macro's functionality.

There unfortunately isn't a short-term fix for this issue, but we're investigating a better long-term solution for Excel and other Office files, and we'll update you when we have news to share.
{panel}
fields.summary: Feedback on the new Office Connector file viewer

h3. Summary

After a space import, the spaces are not listed on the *Space directory*.
 !CONFCLOUD-54874-screenshot_001.png|width=378,height=193,thumbnail!
 * however it can be accessed using the space key:
 !CONFCLOUD-54874-screenshot_002.png|width=372,height=190,thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a space.
 # Go to the *Space directory*

h3. Expected Results

The space is listed properly in the *Space directory*
h3. Actual Results

The space is not listed in the *Space directory*
h3. Workaround

This is an issue with indexing of the space being slow - please wait for a couple of minutes for the space to show up.

Alternatively to kick off another indexing task to get the space to show up faster, favourite the space and unfavourite it. The space will show up in the *Space directory*

fields.description:
After the last changes, when a user enters the edit mode of a page, a new draft of the page is created.

A page is very often opene in edit mode just for copying some Content from the page and paste it to another page. Or it is edited unintentionally.

Normally the user isn't aware of this draft and propably leaves the page by closing it or using the Browsers back button.

All these drafts are kept in the Background and consuming space and are confusing the user because there are no real unpublished changes.

The handling should be optimized at this point because it's really affecting the daily work.

At least it mus be possible to leave a page without leaving page drafts.

 

Thanks a lot for your great Support.

 

Kindest Regards

Wilfried
fields.summary: page editor in confluence allways creates a page draft, even if nothing has been changed

Confluence Cloud

 # Create a Page on Confluence
 # Click on 'Save for Later'
 # Rebuild Confluence's Index

h3. Expected Results

If another user searches for the page, they would see the page results normally.

h3. Actual Results

If another user searches for the page they will see a 'favourite' at the end of the page's description on search page.

h3. Notes

If you search for "favourite", you'll be able to reach the page.

h3. Workaround

There isn't one.

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page on Confluence
 # Add the following label: "my:favourite" to the page.
 # Rebuild Confluence's Index
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

Label "my:favourite" appears on the bottom of the screen.
h3. Actual Results

If you click on "No Labels", the label "my:favourite" will appear and you'll be able to remove it.
Apparently, this only affects this specific label. Not able to reproduce it by "my:test", for example.
h3. Workaround

There isn't one.
